What is the purpose of the `z_validateaddress` command in Verus?

The `z_validateaddress` command is used to return information about a given z address in Verus. It allows users to validate a z address and retrieve details about it, such as whether it is valid, its type (sprout or sapling), and whether it belongs to the user.

z_validateaddress "zaddr"

Return information about the given z address.

Arguments:
1. "zaddr"   (string, required) The z address to validate

Result:
{
 "isvalid" : true|false,   (boolean) If the address is valid or not. If not, this is the only property returned.
 "address" : "zaddr",     (string) The z address validated
 "type" : "xxxx",       (string) "sprout" or "sapling"
 "ismine" : true|false,    (boolean) If the address is yours or not
 "payingkey" : "hex",     (string) [sprout] The hex value of the paying key, a_pk
 "transmissionkey" : "hex",  (string) [sprout] The hex value of the transmission key, pk_enc
 "diversifier" : "hex",    (string) [sapling] The hex value of the diversifier, d
 "diversifiedtransmissionkey" : "hex", (string) [sapling] The hex value of pk_d
}

Examples:
> verus z_validateaddress "zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_validateaddress", "params": ["zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What are the required arguments for the `z_validateaddress` command?
The `z_validateaddress` command requires a single argument, which is the z address to be validated, specified as a string.

z_validateaddress "zaddr"

Return information about the given z address.

Arguments:
1. "zaddr"   (string, required) The z address to validate

Result:
{
 "isvalid" : true|false,   (boolean) If the address is valid or not. If not, this is the only property returned.
 "address" : "zaddr",     (string) The z address validated
 "type" : "xxxx",       (string) "sprout" or "sapling"
 "ismine" : true|false,    (boolean) If the address is yours or not
 "payingkey" : "hex",     (string) [sprout] The hex value of the paying key, a_pk
 "transmissionkey" : "hex",  (string) [sprout] The hex value of the transmission key, pk_enc
 "diversifier" : "hex",    (string) [sapling] The hex value of the diversifier, d
 "diversifiedtransmissionkey" : "hex", (string) [sapling] The hex value of pk_d
}

Examples:
> verus z_validateaddress "zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_validateaddress", "params": ["zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What information is returned by the `z_validateaddress` command if the address is valid?

If the address is valid, the `z_validateaddress` command returns a JSON object containing the following information: 
- `isvalid`: a boolean indicating whether the address is valid
- `address`: the z address that was validated
- `type`: the type of the address, either "sprout" or "sapling"
- `ismine`: a boolean indicating whether the address belongs to the user
- `payingkey` and `transmissionkey`: the hex values of the paying key and transmission key, respectively, for sprout addresses
- `diversifier` and `diversifiedtransmissionkey`: the hex values of the diversifier and diversified transmission key, respectively, for sapling addresses

z_validateaddress "zaddr"

Return information about the given z address.

Arguments:
1. "zaddr"   (string, required) The z address to validate

Result:
{
 "isvalid" : true|false,   (boolean) If the address is valid or not. If not, this is the only property returned.
 "address" : "zaddr",     (string) The z address validated
 "type" : "xxxx",       (string) "sprout" or "sapling"
 "ismine" : true|false,    (boolean) If the address is yours or not
 "payingkey" : "hex",     (string) [sprout] The hex value of the paying key, a_pk
 "transmissionkey" : "hex",  (string) [sprout] The hex value of the transmission key, pk_enc
 "diversifier" : "hex",    (string) [sapling] The hex value of the diversifier, d
 "diversifiedtransmissionkey" : "hex", (string) [sapling] The hex value of pk_d
}

Examples:
> verus z_validateaddress "zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_validateaddress", "params": ["zcWsmqT4X2V4jgxbgiCzyrAfRT1vi1F4sn7M5Pkh66izzw8Uk7LBGAH3DtcSMJeUb2pi3W4SQF8LMKkU2cUuVP68yAGcomL"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
